vague_description: Optimizing resource allocation in a laboratory setting to maximize electricity output.
detailed_description: A scientist is conducting two experiments to produce electricity, experiment alpha and experiment beta. In experiment alpha, \param{MetalAlpha} units of metal and \param{AcidAlpha} units of acid are required to produce \param{ElectricityAlpha} units of electricity. In experiment beta, \param{MetalBeta} units of metal and \param{AcidBeta} units of acid are required to produced \param{ElectricityBeta} units of electricity. The lab has \param{TotalMetal} units of metal and \param{TotalAcid} units of acid available. How many of each experiment should the scientist conduct to maximize the total amount of electricity produced?
target_objective: Maximize the total amount of electricity produced by conducting alpha and beta experiments
target_constraints: Number of alpha experiments is non-negative
Number of beta experiments is non-negative
Metal consumed by alpha and beta experiments is less than or equal to TotalMetal
Acid consumed by alpha and beta experiments is less than or equal to TotalAcid
